byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and CONOR DOUGHERTY

abstract: Electronic Sports League, one of most successful in competitive video gaming, says it will start testing players for performance-enhancing drugs in August 2015; e-sports is evolving into major form of competitive entertainment, with 2015 global revenue estimated at over $250 million from more than 113 million fans.
lead_paragraph: The Electronic Sports League said on Thursday that it would start testing players for performance-enhancing drugs, a regulation move that would align it with more traditional sports leagues.

headline.main: Drug Testing Is Coming to E-Sports
headline.print_headline: Drug Testing Is Coming to E-Gaming

snippet: The Electronic Sports League said on Thursday that it would start testing players for performance-enhancing drugs, a regulation move that would align it with more traditional sports leagues.
